Getting language right, when it matters

Welcome to Our Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI) Hub

In our EDI Vocab Hub, we believe that schools are more than just places of learning—they’re communities where everyone should feel valued, respected, and supported. Our goal is to create an inclusive environment where staff, students, and the wider school community can thrive, regardless of their background, identity, or experiences.

Why Focus on Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion?

When we actively work to understand and celebrate our differences, we create stronger, kinder, and more compassionate communities. In schools, this means fostering a space where everyone—no matter their race, gender, sexuality, ability, religion, or culture—has the opportunity to reach their full potential.
Learning about EDI doesn’t just help individuals; it helps us all grow as a society. By challenging discrimination, addressing unconscious biases, and building an inclusive culture, we can create environments where everyone feels they belong.

What you'll find here

Not sure what a term like “intersectionality” or “neurodiversity” means? Head to our ABCs of EDI, where we break down key terminology in a simple, accessible way. Knowledge is power, and understanding these terms is the first step to building an inclusive school.

Student tips

Resources for Everyone

Our Resources page is packed with tools to expand your knowledge, including YouTube videos, articles, and toolkits. Plus, you can contribute by suggesting your own favourite resources to share with the community—because we all have something to learn and teach.

Visit Resources

Let's Grow Together

Improving equality, diversity, and inclusion isn’t a one-time effort; it’s a journey we take together. Whether you’re a staff member, a student, or just someone passionate about creating a better world, this website is here to support you every step of the way.
By committing to learning and understanding more about EDI, you’re playing an important role in shaping a fairer, kinder, and more inclusive society. Thank you for joining us on this journey—let’s make a difference together!
